model

Class UserMove

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.UserMove
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMove

    public class UserMove
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMove
    UserMove is the basic move type for the SixesWild game They are the only way to score points or mark tiles in Elimination rounds A valid UserMove is 2 or more adjacent tiles that sum to 6
    Author:
    jesse

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserMove()
      Construct a new empty UserMove the initial sum is 0 the initial multiplier is 1, and is doubled for every x2 tile, tripled for every x3 tile

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addTile(AbstractTileContainer tc)
      Add a TileContainer to the UserMove TileContainers that have already been added to the UserMove cannot be added again a TileContainer that is not adjacent to at least one existing TileContainer cannot be added (this prevents diagonal moves) null or empty tiles cannot be added
      void finishMove()
      After any move, valid or invalid, this method should be called, to reset the markings on the tiles, and apply any logic that takes place after either a successful or failed move After any move, all achievements will be checked
      int getScore()
      get the score of this UserMove The score for a valid UserMove is 10 * the number of tiles used * multipliers
      java.util.ArrayList<AbstractTileContainer> getTiles()
      returns all tiles in this UserMove
      boolean isValid()
      A userMove is valid if the sum is 6 and there are two or more tiles
      void pushMove(Level l)
      When a valid move is done, this method is called in order to push that move to the level This method updates the score appropriately

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
